newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Bondes rates mixed at auction.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Bondes rates mixed at auction.

text.p: The rate on Mexican government 364-day development bonds, or Bondes, rose 0.10 percentage point to 1.36 percent above the one-month Cetes rate in Tuesday's primary auction, dealers estimated.
The 364-day Bondes were assigned at 98.76441 pesos.
Demand for the one-year Bondes was 1.83 billion pesos, compared with the 500 million one-year Bondes offered by the Banco de Mexico.
The rate on the 728-day Bondes fell 0.07 percentage point to 1.40 percent above the 28-day Cetes rate.
The 728-day Bondes were assigned at 97.70413 pesos.
Demand for the 728-day Bondes was 2.53 billion pesos, compared with the 700 million offered by the Banco de Mexico.
